author: dock_boss
content: I am not sure if I am missing something or not but why is EIP-1559 a  new transaction type from EIP-2930?

author: sky.cactus
content: Because it introduces two new properties and removes one.

author: dock_boss
content: So then could I just use the transaction type 1 if I didn't want my gas being burned? Is that how it works or am I missing something. A better way to ask is there any advantage to use one or the other?

author: sky.cactus
content: All transactions get "upgraded" to 1559 transactions during the block production and validation process.  It is strictly worse to use 2930 or legacy transactions compared to 1559 transactions.

author: sky.cactus
content: The automatic upgrade results in the worst possible 1559 transaction for you essentially.

author: dock_boss
content: I see, does that mean that 2930 transactions are already obsolete?

author: sky.cactus
content: They will continue to work, but I wouldn't recommend using them if you have the option to use 1559.  Same with legacy transactions.
